item.title: Streatham terror attack: Sudesh Amman 'wanted to kill the Queen'
item.description: Sudesh Amman stabbed two people in south London only days after being released from prison.

item.title: Womanâ€™s DNA helps convict her father for rape
item.description: An adoptee's discovery that her mother was raped at 13 leads to 11 years in jail for Carvel Bennett.

item.title: Robyn Williams: Met Police takes legal action over officer's reinstatement
item.description: Robyn Williams was reinstated after being dismissed over possession of a child abuse video.

item.title: Former Cleveland Police chief Mike Veale faces gross misconduct hearing
item.description: The police watchdog says there is "sufficient evidence" Mike Veale breached professional standards.

item.title: Drug deaths in England and Wales highest since 1993
item.description: In total, 4,561 deaths related to drug poisoning were registered in England and Wales last year.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: History-making weightlifter 'from a home of grafters'
item.description: Emily Campbell's friends and family in Nottingham had helped her raise money to train for the sport.

item.title: Joe Anderson: Liverpool council must reconsider paying legal fees
item.description: Former Liverpool mayor Joe Anderson is being investigated for bribery and witness intimidation.

item.title: Brands Hatch: Robert Foote named as marshal killed in crash
item.description: Former mayor Robert Foote has been named locally as the man who died in a crash at the race circuit.

item.title: Tewkesbury PE teacher struck off for faked pupil sports course certificates
item.description: The teacher who worked at a special school in Gloucestershire did not submit any pupils' work.

item.title: Stonehenge: Brian May finds oldest family photo
item.description: The image dating back to the 1860s was found in the collection of Queen guitarist Brian May.

item.title: 'Hot Fuzz' Hardwick swan detained for blocking traffic
item.description: The "angry" bird is taken into police custody after "swanning around" a busy road, police say.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: Assisted dying: Campaigners renewed hope for change in the law
item.description: David Peace intends to travel abroad to end his life before his motor neurone disease deteriorates further.

item.title: West Midlands canal rubbish is 'worst ever'
item.description: The Canal & River Trust says the waste dumped in West Midlands waterways is the worst it's ever seen.

item.title: Charlotte Worthington: Family hope Olympic gold inspires others
item.description: Charlotte Worthington's parents hope her BMX freestyle Olympic gold inspires others.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Man builds squirrel course in Hitchin garden
item.description: Steve Barley spent almost three months building the course, designed around events in a heptathlon.

item.title: Video: Eggborough Power Station cooling towers demolished
item.description: The 300ft (90m) high structures in Eggborough were demolished as part of a plan to redevelop the site.

item.title: Harry Kane: Tottenham Hotspur striker continues stand-off with club
item.description: Tottenham striker Harry Kane has failed to report to the club's training ground for a second day as the stand-off over his future continues amid interest from Manchester City.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Keely Hodgkinson wins silver behind USA's Athing Mu
item.description: Teenager Keely Hodgkinson wins 800m silver at the Olympic Games in a new British record of 1:55.88 as US star Athing Mu takes gold.

item.title: British and Irish Lions: Kyle Sinckler can play in third Test after citing dismissed
item.description: A citing against British and Irish Lions prop Kyle Sinckler for an alleged bite in the second Test against South Africa has been dismissed.
